references.paper_title: High-resolution image synthesis with latent diffusion models
references.reason: This paper introduces Stable Diffusion, a foundational model for text-to-image generation that the current research builds upon and improves.

references.paper_title: Learning transferable visual models from natural language supervision
references.reason: CLIP, introduced in this paper, is a crucial component of many text-to-image models, providing the mechanism for aligning text descriptions with visual features.

references.paper_title: EMU: Enhancing image generation models using photogenic needles in a haystack
references.reason: This paper demonstrates the impact of high-quality training data on improving image aesthetics, a key aspect addressed by the current research.

references.paper_title: FreeU: Free lunch in diffusion U-Net
references.reason: FreeU, presented in this paper, directly improves the quality of image generation by modifying the base diffusion model, providing a crucial comparison point for the proposed method.

references.paper_title: Diffusion model alignment using direct preference optimization
references.reason: DPO, detailed in this paper, demonstrates an alternative approach to improving image aesthetics through direct optimization based on human preferences, offering another comparative method for the current research.
